prompt: Record a robotic bronchoscopy note for Dr. Dr. Lee. Patient is 71yo female. We targeted the LUL and LLL using Ion and Cios Spin. Both nodules showed malignant neoplasm on ROSE. EBUS was performed, no nodes sampled.
completion:
NOTE_ID: note_058
SOURCE_FILE: note_058.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: [Name / Self, Referred]

INDICATION FOR OPERATION 71-year-old female who presents with lung nodules requiring bronchoscopic diagnosis.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was signed.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule 
Malignant neoplasm (ROSE confirmation for LUL and LLL nodules) 

PROCEDURE
Robotic navigational bronchoscopy (Ion) to LUL and LLL targets 
Radial EBUS (rEBUS) localization 
Cone-beam CT imaging (Cios Spin) with trajectory adjustment and confirmation 
TBNA of LUL and LLL targets 
Transbronchial cryobiopsy of LUL target 
Transbronchial biopsy (forceps) and brushing of LUL target 
Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) 
Fiducial marker placement (LUL) 
EBUS mediastinal/hilar lymph node survey (inspection only) 

ATTENDING Dr. Lee
ASSISTANT Dr. Gomez
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an 
independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Linear EBUS; Radial EBUS; Ion Robotic Bronchoscope; Cios Spin System.
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and procedure location.
Patient position: [Supine]. Initial airway inspection: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
A CT-based navigation plan was loaded into the robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Target 1: LUL Nodule Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.
The Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Apico-posterior Segment of LUL (LB1+2).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.2 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target under navigational guidance.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Eccentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed. 3D reconstructions on an independent workstation were interpreted by the attending.
Adjustment: The system was updated with the acquired nodule location and the robotic catheter was adjusted to the new target.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 4 samples collected.
Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of malignant neoplasm.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: LLL Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Lateral Basal Segment of LLL (LB9).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.8 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Eccentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: Attempted but technically challenging; unable to penetrate airway wall for consistent biopsy.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of malignant neoplasm.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the LLL to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 10R, 11Ri.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
LUL nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
LUL nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
LLL nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
LLL nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
71-year-old female with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

LUL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for malignant neoplasm.
Fiducial marker placed.

LLL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for malignant neoplasm.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

Target: Lesion is approximately 1.2 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Eccentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe used; 3 samples collected successfully.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the LUL Anterior to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).

Lingula nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
LUL Anterior nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
LUL Anterior nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

82-year-old female with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

Lingula Nodule: ROSE conclusive for atypical cells present.

LUL Anterior Nodule: ROSE conclusive for atypical cells present.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Linear EBUS; Radial EBUS; Ion Robotic Bronchoscope; Cios Spin System.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and procedure location.
Patient position: [Supine]. Initial airway inspection: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
A CT-based navigation plan was loaded into the robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Target 1: RUL Nodule Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.
The Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Apical Segment of RUL (RB1).
Target: Lesion is approximately 2.1 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target under navigational guidance.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed. 3D reconstructions on an independent workstation were interpreted by the attending.
Adjustment: The system was updated with the acquired nodule location and the robotic catheter was adjusted to the new target.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 4 samples collected.
Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of suspicious for malignancy.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: RLL Superior Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Superior Segment of RLL (RB6).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.0 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe used; 3 samples collected successfully.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of suspicious for malignancy.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the RLL Superior to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 11Rs, 11L.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

RUL nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
RUL nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
RLL Superior nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
RLL Superior nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
88-year-old male with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

RUL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for suspicious for malignancy.
Fiducial marker placed.

RLL Superior Nodule: ROSE conclusive for suspicious for malignancy.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Target: Lesion is approximately 1.5 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target under navigational guidance.

Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed. 3D reconstructions on an independent workstation were interpreted by the attending.
Adjustment: The system was updated with the acquired nodule location and the robotic catheter was adjusted to the new target.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 4 samples collected.
Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of atypical cells present.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: LUL Anterior Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Anterior Segment of LUL (LB3).
Target: Lesion is approximately 0.8 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Eccentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe used; 3 samples collected successfully.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of atypical cells present.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the LUL Anterior to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 10R, 10L.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

Lingula nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
Lingula nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
LUL Anterior nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
LUL Anterior nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

Lingula Nodule: ROSE conclusive for atypical cells present.
Fiducial marker placed.

LUL Anterior Nodule: ROSE conclusive for atypical cells present.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of malignant neoplasm.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: [Name / Self, Referred]

INDICATION FOR OPERATION 88-year-old female who presents with lung nodules requiring bronchoscopic diagnosis.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was signed.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule 
Atypical cells present (ROSE confirmation for LUL and LLL nodules) 

PROCEDURE
Robotic navigational bronchoscopy (Ion) to LUL and LLL targets 
Radial EBUS (rEBUS) localization 
Cone-beam CT imaging (Cios Spin) with trajectory adjustment and confirmation 
TBNA of LUL and LLL targets 
Transbronchial cryobiopsy of LUL target 
Transbronchial biopsy (forceps) and brushing of LUL target 
Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) 
Fiducial marker placement (LUL) 
EBUS mediastinal/hilar lymph node survey (inspection only) 

ATTENDING Dr. Patel
ASSISTANT Dr. Gomez
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an 
independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Linear EBUS; Radial EBUS; Ion Robotic Bronchoscope; Cios Spin System.
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and procedure location.
Patient position: [Supine]. Initial airway inspection: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
A CT-based navigation plan was loaded into the robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Target 1: LUL Nodule Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.
The Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Apico-posterior Segment of LUL (LB1+2).
Target: Lesion is approximately 0.8 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target under navigational guidance.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed. 3D reconstructions on an independent workstation were interpreted by the attending.
Adjustment: The system was updated with the acquired nodule location and the robotic catheter was adjusted to the new target.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 4 samples collected.
Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of atypical cells present.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: LLL Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Lateral Basal Segment of LLL (LB9).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.5 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Eccentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe used; 3 samples collected successfully.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of atypical cells present.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the LLL to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 11Rs, 11L.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
LUL nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
LUL nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
LLL nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
LLL nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
88-year-old female with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

LUL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for atypical cells present.
Fiducial marker placed.

LLL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for atypical cells present.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date] CC Referred Physician: [Name / Self, Referred]

INDICATION FOR OPERATION 79-year-old male who presents with lung nodules requiring bronchoscopic diagnosis.
The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient wished to proceed and informed consent was signed.

CONSENT Obtained before the procedure.
Indications, potential complications, and alternatives were discussed with the patient or surrogate.
Consent was signed and witnessed by an assisting medical professional.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS
R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule 
Diagnostic for carcinoma (ROSE confirmation for LUL and LLL nodules) 

PROCEDURE
Robotic navigational bronchoscopy (Ion) to LUL and LLL targets 
Radial EBUS (rEBUS) localization 
Cone-beam CT imaging (Cios Spin) with trajectory adjustment and confirmation 
TBNA of LUL and LLL targets 
Transbronchial cryobiopsy of LUL target 
Transbronchial biopsy (forceps) and brushing of LUL target 
Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) 
Fiducial marker placement (LUL) 
EBUS mediastinal/hilar lymph node survey (inspection only) 

ATTENDING Dr. Lee
ASSISTANT Dr. Davis
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an 
independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Linear EBUS; Radial EBUS; Ion Robotic Bronchoscope; Cios Spin System.
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and procedure location.
Patient position: [Supine]. Initial airway inspection: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
A CT-based navigation plan was loaded into the robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Target 1: LUL Nodule Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.
The Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Apico-posterior Segment of LUL (LB1+2).
Target: Lesion is approximately 2.1 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target under navigational guidance.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Eccentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed. 3D reconstructions on an independent workstation were interpreted by the attending.
Adjustment: The system was updated with the acquired nodule location and the robotic catheter was adjusted to the new target.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 4 samples collected.
Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of diagnostic for carcinoma.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: LLL Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Lateral Basal Segment of LLL (LB9).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.8 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: Attempted but technically challenging; unable to penetrate airway wall for consistent biopsy.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of diagnostic for carcinoma.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the LLL to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 10R, 10L.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
LUL nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
LUL nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
LLL nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
LLL nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
79-year-old male with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

LUL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for diagnostic for carcinoma.
Fiducial marker placed.

LLL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for diagnostic for carcinoma.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule 
Diagnostic for carcinoma (ROSE confirmation for LUL and LLL nodules) 

PROCEDURE
Robotic navigational bronchoscopy (Ion) to LUL and LLL targets 
Radial EBUS (rEBUS) localization

TBNA of LUL and LLL targets

Fiducial marker placement (LUL) 
EBUS mediastinal/hilar lymph node survey (inspection only) 

ATTENDING Dr. Smith
ASSISTANT Dr. Davis
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

MONITORING Pulse oximetry, heart rate, telemetry, and blood pressure were continuously monitored by an 
independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Linear EBUS; Radial EBUS; Ion Robotic Bronchoscope; Cios Spin System.
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed confirming patient identity, planned procedures, and procedure location.
Patient position: [Supine]. Initial airway inspection: Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem from mucus.
A CT-based navigation plan was loaded into the robotic bronchoscopy platform.

Target 1: LUL Nodule Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.
The Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Apico-posterior Segment of LUL (LB1+2).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.8 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target under navigational guidance.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed. 3D reconstructions on an independent workstation were interpreted by the attending.
Adjustment: The system was updated with the acquired nodule location and the robotic catheter was adjusted to the new target.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 4 samples collected.
Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of diagnostic for carcinoma.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: LLL Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Lateral Basal Segment of LLL (LB9).
Target: Lesion is approximately 2.1 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: Attempted but technically challenging; unable to penetrate airway wall for consistent biopsy.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of diagnostic for carcinoma.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the LLL to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 11Rs, 11L.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
LUL nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
LUL nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
LLL nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
LLL nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

IMPRESSION / PLAN
82-year-old female with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

LUL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for diagnostic for carcinoma.
Fiducial marker placed.

LLL Nodule: ROSE conclusive for diagnostic for carcinoma.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

Target 1: RML Nodule Robotic navigation bronchoscopy was performed with the Ion platform using partial registration.
The Ion robotic catheter was used to engage the Medial Segment of RML (RB5).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.8 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target under navigational guidance.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Eccentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): A low-dose spin was performed. 3D reconstructions on an independent workstation were interpreted by the attending.
Adjustment: The system was updated with the acquired nodule location and the robotic catheter was adjusted to the new target.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 4 samples collected.
Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of suspicious for malignancy.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: RUL Posterior Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Posterior Segment of RUL (RB2).
Target: Lesion is approximately 2.1 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe used; 3 samples collected successfully.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of suspicious for malignancy.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the RUL Posterior to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 10R, 11Ri.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

RML nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
RML nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
RUL Posterior nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
RUL Posterior nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

88-year-old female with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

RML Nodule: ROSE conclusive for suspicious for malignancy.
Fiducial marker placed.

RUL Posterior Nodule: ROSE conclusive for suspicious for malignancy.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of diagnostic for carcinoma.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.

BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.

ASSISTANT Dr. Wright
SUPPORT STAFF RN: [Name] RT: [Name]

independent trained observer throughout the procedure.

INSTRUMENTATION Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope; Linear EBUS; Radial EBUS; Ion Robotic Bronchoscope; Cios Spin System.
ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None

Transbronchial Biopsy: Alligator forceps; 1 sample collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe, 6-second freeze time; 6 samples collected.
Brushing: Protected cytology brush; 1 sample collected.
BAL: 20 cc NS instilled, 10 cc returned.
Fiducial: One 0.8mm x 3mm soft tissue gold marker was placed under fluoroscopy guidance.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of diagnostic for carcinoma.
No bleeding was noted prior to withdrawal.

Target 2: LUL Anterior Nodule Robotic navigation was performed to the Anterior Segment of LUL (LB3).
Target: Lesion is approximately 1.8 cm in diameter. Catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target.
rEBUS: Radial EBUS confirmed an Concentric signal. Features noted: Continuous margin and absence of linear-discrete air bronchogram.
Cone-beam CT (Cios Spin): Spin performed, 3D images interpreted, and catheter position adjusted/confirmed.

Sampling:
TBNA: 21G needle; 6 samples collected.
Cryobiopsy: 1.1mm cryoprobe used; 3 samples collected successfully.
BAL: 60 cc NS instilled, 15 cc returned.

ROSE: Conclusive evidence of diagnostic for carcinoma.
Hemostasis: 200mg of Tranexamic Acid (TXA) was placed in the LUL Anterior to achieve hemostasis. No evidence of bleeding upon inspection.

EBUS STAGING The EBUS bronchoscope was introduced. All lymph node stations were assessed.
Technique: Only nodes ≥5 mm in short axis were considered for sampling.
EBUS elastography was performed to assess tissue stiffness (Type 1-3).

Stations Inspected: 4R, 4L, 7, 11Rs, 11L.
Site 1 - Station 4L: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET. Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign).
Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Site 2 - Station 7: <10 mm on CT, Non-Hypermetabolic on PET.
Elastography Type 1 (soft/benign). Not sampled (not clinically indicated).

Other Stations: No detectable lymph nodes noted in other stations.
No immediate complications. The patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to recovery in stable condition.

SPECIMENS
Lingula nodule: TBNA (4 samples), TBBX (1 sample), Cryobiopsy (6 samples), Brush (1 sample) — Pathology/Cytology.
Lingula nodule: BAL — Microbiology.
LUL Anterior nodule: TBNA (6 samples) — Cytology.
LUL Anterior nodule: BAL — Cell Count, Microbiology, Cytology.

91-year-old male with bilateral lung nodules successfully sampled via Robotic Bronchoscopy.

Lingula Nodule: ROSE conclusive for diagnostic for carcinoma.
Fiducial marker placed.

LUL Anterior Nodule: ROSE conclusive for diagnostic for carcinoma.

EBUS Staging: Complete inspection performed;
no nodes met criteria for sampling (benign elastography/size/PET features).

Follow-up in clinic for final pathology results.
